Those who are of the household of faith should never neglect the assembling of themselves together; for this is God's appointed means of 


                                    -273- 

leading His children into unity, in order that in Christian love and fellowship they may help, strengthen, and encourage one another. My brethren and sisters in Greater New York, if you would come together for prayer meetings; if, after confession of sin and humiliation of soul, you would have a love-feast--every heart filled with true love for his brethren--you would see the salvation of God. . . .
